dead_letter_exchange.description: Optional name of an exchange to which messages will be republished if they are rejected or expire

name.description: Name of the queue to create

message_ttl.description: How long a message can live in queue before it is discarded (milliseconds)

state.description: Whether the queue should be present or absent Only present implemented atm

max_length.description: How many messages can the queue contain before it starts rejecting

arguments.description: extra arguments for queue. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary

auto_delete.description: if the queue should delete itself after all queues/queues unbound from it

auto_expires.description: How long a queue can be unused before it is automatically deleted (milliseconds)

dead_letter_routing_key.description: Optional replacement routing key to use when a message is dead-lettered. Original routing key will be used if unset

durable.description: whether queue is durable or not
